title: Subscription process - Business rules
content:
The subscription process relies on a few simple business rules. Rules repeat from one phase to another when the end user can make a change to a field affected by a business rule during that phase.

Subscription global rules

In the out-of-the-box asset subscription workflow, the rules detailed for each of the following events apply to all processes.

Event Condition Service Management actions
Entering Subscription Type is empty Subscription Type = Normal

After change

 None Start date = mandatory
None Subscriber = mandatory
Start date isn't empty, and End date isn't empty Validate: End date > Start date
Currency isn't empty Validate: Initial cost and Recurring cost are both not empty.

Display the subscription workflow error message in case of a failure.
Recurring cost isn't empty Validate: Recurring period isn't empty.

Display the subscription workflow error message in case of a failure.
Recurring period isn't empty

Validate: Recurring cost isn't empty.

Display the subscription workflow error message in case of a failure.
None

Validate:

  • Subscribed to device isn't empty, or
  • Subscribed to service isn't empty, or
  • Subscribed to infrastructure peripheral isn't empty

Display the subscription workflow error message for Service Management subscriptions in case of a failure.
None

Validate:

  • Both Subscribed to device and Subscribed to service are empty, or
  • Both Subscribed to device and Subscribed to infrastructure peripheral are empty, or
  • Both infrastructure peripheral and Subscribed to service are empty

Display the subscription workflow error message for Service Management subscriptions in case of a failure.
Display label is empty

Display label = display label of the first of the following which isn't empty:

  • Device subscribed to
  • Service subscribed to
  • Infrastructure peripheral subscribed to
Status is empty, and Start date isn't empty, and Start date is earlier than now Subscription status = active
Status is empty, and Start date isn't empty, and Start date is later than now Subscription status = pending
Based on Service Definition is empty, and Subscribed to service isn't empty, and Service Definition of Subscribed to service isn't empty Based on Service Definition = Service Definition of Subscribed to service
After applying changes Initiated by request isn't empty, Offering Provider type of Initiated by request is DND Subscription in Initiated by request = current Subscription ID 

Note: This rule is only applicable to cloud subscriptions when you enable Service Design and Deployment.

Rendering

 None

Show Subscribed to service list with filter:

Service definition Phase Id = Operate and Decommission
None

Actual service Phase Id = Operate and Decommission
None

Device Phase Id not = Ended or Canceled
None

Infrastructure and peripheral Phase Id not = Ended or Canceled
Id isn't empty and Subscribed to service is empty

Subscribed to service = hidden

Note: If you want to always show the Service field in the subscription details from, you can disable this rule. 
Id isn't empty and Subscribed to device is empty

Subscribed to device = hidden

Note: If you want to always show the Device field in the subscription details from, you can disable this rule. In addition, you also need to disable the "Hide Device" rule in Subscription > Normal > Rendering forms and Subscription > Subscription Lifecycle > Rendering forms.
Id isn't empty and Subscribed to infrastructure peripheral is empty

Subscribed to infrastructure peripheral = hidden

Note: If you want to always show the Infrastructure and peripheral field in the subscription details from, you can disable this rule.  In addition, you also need to disable the "Hide Infrastructure and peripheral" rule in Subscription > Normal > Rendering forms and Subscription > Subscription Lifecycle > Rendering forms.
Initiated by request isn't empty and the request offering is an offering for a cloud service, or Initiated by offering is an offering for a cloud service Initial cost = read only

Recurring cost = read only

Recurring period = read only

Currency = read only

Per schedule

 Set Recurring Period to read-only if the subscription is from a request or an offering for a cloud service.  Set scheduler on End date. Once triggered, Subscription status = expired.
Set Recurring Cost to read-only if the subscription is from a request or an offering for a cloud service.  Set scheduler on Start date. Once triggered, Subscription status = active.

Subscription normal rules

In the out-of-the-box asset subscription workflow, the rules detailed for each of the following events apply to all processes.

Event Condition Service Management actions

After applying changes

 Phase ID is changed to Active Generate expense lines based on the configured cost allocation rules
Phase ID is changed to Inactive  Stop generating new expense lines and delete the generated expense lines that are in Projected status

Subscription lifecycle rules

In the out-of-the-box cloud service subscription workflow, the rules detailed for each of the following events apply to all processes.

Event Condition Service Management actions

After applying changes

 Phase ID is changed to Active Generate expense lines based on the configured cost allocation rules
Phase ID is changed to Modify, Expire, or Cancel Stop generating new expense lines and delete the generated expense lines that are in Projected status
